oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of the addition of In3+, Sn2+ and Zn2+ ions on the electrochemical behavior of Al-Zn, Al-In and Al-Sn binary alloys in 3.5%NaCl
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VENUGOPAL, A
RAJA, VS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effect of the addition of In3+, Sn2+ and Zn2+ ions on the electrochemical corrosion behavior of Al-Zn, Al-In and AI-Sn binary alloys in 3.5% NaCl has been investigated using, polarization and AC impedance and x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy. It was found that Zn added to Al-ln or AI-Sn acts synergistically with the activators to enhance the dissolution of Al. However, the synergism between Zn and In is stronger than that between Zn and Sn. Based on impedance and XPS results the existence of cations with valencies other than 3 (In+In2+ and Sn2+/Sn4+ ions) in the films have been suggested to be responsible for generation of point defects in the film, which in turn activate Al.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: CORROSION AND ITS CONTROLS, VOLS I AND II,1067-1073
